Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ALauTraveller
Reviews.Content: The good: the location of the hotel is just 2 minutes from Las Ramblas, and still is not as noisy as if you would be staying in Las Ramblas. Breakfast was good, but simple. The room was comfortable. The receptionist was quite friendly and always willing to help. Really clean hotel. The bad: the room and the corridor they started to flood as it was raining heavily. As the hotel used to be a nunnery, there are some structural things that don't really fit into a hotel. For example, depending on the floor you are staying you might need to take 2 elevators. Summary: average place to stay, don't ask for too much comfort, good location, average service.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Visit April 2012”
Reviews.Author: esp31
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideally placed for visiting the city. being 200 metres from the Ramblas and in the centre of the city. The TMB station on the L3 line allows one easy access to most, if not all, parts of Barcelona. Having been to Barcelona many times before, this visit was mainly for relaxation and so visits to Gaudi buildings were out on this occasion. Breakfast was just ideal for us and the reception staff were most helpful e.g. ordering taxis and knowing which taxi was for which person and where they were going to and welcoming us as previous visitors. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Not special lokation great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been here for 3 nights. The room was very simple not even a minibar or information about the facilities. Breakfast was great and lokation perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HaylingIslander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sant Agusti in March for four nights. I was rather concerned as I had read comments about the reception staff not being very helpful but this couldn't have been further from the fact - they couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We found the breakfast to be excellent - plenty of it and good variety. Another comment I had read was that the wifi didn't work - we had good wifi in our room as well as the bar and breakfast room. Each evening we would go the bar for a nightcap - the barman was very friendly and remembered what we liked. The only slight complaint would be that the bed was very hard and we woke up rather stiff each morning! The hotel is in a great position though do watch your valuables in the city - my sister was pickpocketed on the train from the airport. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Natascha76
Reviews.Content: Although situated very close to the Ramblas and the boqueria market, it is very quiet. The metro station Liceu is at about 100 metres. It is a great place to stay when you want to explore Barcelona. The rooms aren't very big but clean, with good beds and a nice bathroom. The desk clerk is very friendly and the hotel has free internet in the lobby. I really liked staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place but very poor breakfeast and too much noise”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: Very near to the market "la boqueria" and the center of the city. At five minute from the subway. But please don't take the breakfast in this hotel. You can't get fresh fruit juice. No spanish ham. It's better to take the first meat of the day out or in the market. And the rooms are very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ariel155
Reviews.Content: I spent there 3 nights and everything was perfect: the room was clean, bathroom tidy, the clerk polite and very helpful, free wi-fi... and although situated right a few meters from the Rambla and the Metro station (Liceu), very quiet and no noise at all. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and not very impressive”
Reviews.Author: timothymarkwebb
Reviews.Content: Admittedly I stayed here during Mobile World Congress when hotel room rates sky rocket but at £200+ per night this is daylight robbery. It is at best a good 2 star not a 3 star and the rooms and bathrooms are very very basic. Simple things like shampoo are not replaced during your stay and there are no irons/iron boards for guests to use meaning that you have to pay the hotel to do them for you on a very loose schedule. To be fair they ironed what I needed within the timeframe I needed them but I am disappointed that you cannot borrow an iron. Before getting to Barcelona I stayed in 5 star hotels in Sao Paulo and Mexico City and they both had irons for guest use. On the plus side the wi-fi is free and pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: uk_wizzard
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sant Agusti is in the perfect location in the Heart of Barcelona. Located in a side street just off la rambla it is as near to the bright lights of Barcelona as you could want but being just off the main street it is still nice and quiet. We were greeted warmly by the hotel reception and given keys to our room (top floor as we asked, even if we could not remember asking for this). The lift took us up and as the door opens its a lovely view down the corridor in the eaves of the roof. The room was clean and spacious with a drinks fridge, safe, tv, radio, hairdrier, shower and bath. There was a lovely big skylight allowing lots of natural light into the room, this gave a view across the skyline so we could see the cathedral in the distance but unfortunately we could not look down on to the square but that was not really a problem. The hotel served what i guess could best be described as a continental breakfast with all the usual cakes, breads and meat out but there was also a choice of cereals, toast, scrambled eggs (one slice or two) and sausages along with tea, coffee and juice. The downsides to the hotel were the thin walls dividing the rooms, the lack of tea making facilities in the room and some questionable characters hanging around the square at all times of the day but to be fair we were never bothered by anyone during our stay. The hotel gets a thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveB1928
Reviews.Content: A great location, At the end of the road just on La Rambla, is the underground station of Liceu. You are a 10 min walk down to the port area. The rooms were a little small, but big enough room for a good double bed, the bathroom was clean, it was a little cold in the room at night, I did struggled with the heating/air con controls, I found the spare blankets the 2nd night, so the temperature wasn't to much of an issue. All in all a good cheap hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: cheryl b
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel twice , its in an ideal location just off La Ramblas clean and comfortable and would definitely stay again and recommend to friends .

Reviews.Title: “was ok for what is was”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller100000
Reviews.Content: was cold at night - not allowed any more blankets. very grumpy people! but v good location and very pretty. breakfast good enough. toilet smelt of drains.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: osaka2010
Reviews.Content: Nice overall. I have requested a room with balcony if possible and surprisingly we got our request. Room is clean. Breakfast is ok but good enough to fill us up for the morning. Location is very convenient. Easy to go out and shop around and bring your stuff back to the hotel within 10 mins walk. Other reviewers were right. Be careful and maybe try not to go out on your own to the back street. Going out to the La Ramblas with lots of people are ok I think. One morning, my husband went out on his own and he was encountered by two Spanish guy and they took the I-phone out from his front pocket on his jeans, they are pretty quick but luckily, my husband was able to grab the phone back and the two guys took off. So, be careful! With the price we paid and the location, I think I will come back to this hotel. Wi-Fi connection is not very good, we have to hold our Ipad close to the wall in a certain direction in order to get connection.

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: JPPAAL
Reviews.Content: very basic hotel, when you take a look at the reception you might think it is a great hotel. the first night we had a double room with single beds. the man at the lobby arrenged us a double bed the next day. the bedrooms are very basic, without thermostatic shower tap. no minibar and the tv-channels were constant disrupted. breakfast was very poor, bad coffee and orange juice and very poor choice. ADVICE: always watch your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “danger of robberies”
Reviews.Author: kathryn s
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with pleasant rooms and a good breakfast, perfectly situated if it were not for the fact that robberies abound in the area, especially in the square where the hotel is situated. We were robbed almost at the door of the hotel and were told that it was a regular occurence. If you do decide to go there, be very careful!

Reviews.Title: “Sant Agusti is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hadlouca
Reviews.Content: IT was a nice clean hotel and the location couldn`t have been any better, right next to the La Ramblas. The breakfast was ok, good value for money.The only complaint i had and the rest of our friends, was that there was no soap provided 2 wash your hands even after using the toilet, which for hygiene alone, every room should be applied with a bar of soap. Inspite of the famous Spanish hospitality the only smile we got in the 4 days we stayed there was from the chamber maid. Overall our stay wasn`t too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for your stay in Barca”
Reviews.Author: ASandbergen
Reviews.Content: Just 50 meters from the Ramblas and metrostation Liceu this hotel is perfect located. It gives you good value for your money. The staff can be a bit friendlier and the breakfast is not efficient organized, but hey: if that's the only inconvience there is... The bed are real Spanish: a bit hard. The hotel is an old monestary and some details can be found in the hotel. There is also free wifi. So: if you're looking for a hotel in the centre of Barcelona and you don't want to spend a fortune: this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for enjoying Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and English-speaking. Excellent location just off the Rambla, near the Liceu subway, and around the corner from the Boqueria market. Varied and extensive buffet breakfast, quite good and plentiful. We stayed in one of the premium top-floor rooms, worth the money, nice view, nice atmosphere, though not too large. A/C worked, no real noise from other rooms or street. Not an American-style five-star hotel, but a solid choice for an experienced traveller. They do a good job. Would book in here for our next stay without looking for another place.

Reviews.Title: “functional”
Reviews.Author: miketheshrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel whilst needing an overnight stop in Barcelona. I have found quite a lot that in Spain and particularly Italy that hotels might have say a 3 star rating because of facilities, restaurant, bar etc but then restaurant only used for breakfast?. Great location and fair price. Thin walls, conversations and televisions could be heard but to be fair very quiet through the night. Breakfast ok, would use again in same circumstance, but if travelling for leisure would want better. Found staff to be a little surly but not unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, though average 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: MD_33_Bucharest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 100 m away from the famous La Ramblas in a quiet Sant Agusti Sq; this is about half the way between the Port Vell and Placa Catalunya. The Liceu metro station is 100 m from the hotel; perfect location However, average 3 stars hotel. Breakfast is below average, few choices repeated each day. Rooms are small, although clean and quiet. The pillows and the mattress are not the most comfortable, few TV choices and the water in the bathroom is too soft (low hardness), therefore you don't really know when the soap goes away. All in all, if you exclude breakfast and book in advance you can get a 100 eur/ double room/ night which for the location and the 3- stars could be a deal.

Reviews.Title: “miserable/unhelpful staff, misleading website”
Reviews.Author: SueBBournemouth
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Sant Agusti with our 9 year old son. There was no pleasant greeting upon check in, no offer to help carry bags, the only information given was what time breakfast is served - we were then left to find our room without directions or advice! We had requested a double bed (booked this in August), no double bed and when I complained it was a curt 'not possible and we have no information on this' even though it was clearly written on our booking form. The room couldn't have been more basic - no drawers, no door hook, no kettle, thin old and worn bed covers and towels the same. Hairdryer didn't work (this was replaced eventually but the only setting was very hot) and the double balcony doors didn't close properly - so very noisy all through the night with sounds of drunks/homeless around square. Their website proudly talks of bar and dinner being served - JOKE as this was closed and when I asked the front desk I was just told 'it is closed' with no other explanation. Asked to print out boarding cards, yet again 'no not possible', asked them to book an airport transfer for us and again 'no' was the answer. Breakfast appalling - very basic and no fruit or fresh juice - only flavoured water!! One good point only - the location! We called it Fawlty Towers!! This is a 'budget' hotel priced at mid range level....awful!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Hampton, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Disinterested Service”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sant Agusti in Barcelona for two nights and while the location is convenient and the room was clean, we found the service below average. The front desk staff and service was perfunctory at best. There is no parking at the hotel but there are garages within a block or two though the hotel does not help with where to park in any way. They have a bank of three computers connected to the internet for the guests but no printer. When we asked about printing a boarding pass we were directed to a creepy internet cafe and paid 5 euro for 30 minutes and printing cost. I would not choose to stay at Hotel Sant Agusti again.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-week break”
Reviews.Author: littlewelshguy
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked more of the hotel or staff. We arrived just after 11 and although we couldn't check in before 2, reception were quite happy for us to leave our luggage (yes, I know that's what left luggage is for (!) but it helps when staff are happy to offer a service with a smile, rather than make you feel like you're imposing). Double room perfectly ok - clean, comfortable and quiet (even those the hotel was full there was no noise). Breakfast was nothing exciting - rolls (sweet and savoury), meat, cheese, yogurts etc. but the quality and quantity could not be faulted. Very close to La Rambla (Liceu metro stop 5 mins stroll) as others have noted, but again as has been said elsewhere, very quiet area at night. A brilliant stay overall - and if you're wondering why the tables outside next door (Rita Blue) are so full, just try the food (you won't be disappointed!).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice plaza outside”
Reviews.Author: g_whitloc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with decent bar next store. Close to Las Ramblas, Metro stops and other fun plazas. Top floor rooms are the best and have great views of the city. Staff could have been more friendly and baggage check room is on the honor system so lock your bags. Would definitely stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Homeless had better beds”
Reviews.Author: OllieDublin
Reviews.Content: Booked a double bed for two days in this hotel in late september. when we turned up and were allocated a twin room with no possibility of a double. After a little pressure a double magically appeared. The Walls are paper thin and every sound can be heard from the rooms either side. The bed was the worst I have ever slept on, the mattress supports were broken and the bed sank to the middle. There is a court yard in front of the hotel, which each night a group of homeless gather. On both nights we were there, the homeless people were very quite and didn't hassle anyone. I was actually quite envious of a mattress one of them was sleeping on. The only positive remark I have about this hotel is the location, right beside la rambles and also beside a underground. if your stuck for a room book it. If not I wouldn't go near it.

Reviews.Title: “lovley hotel”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovley 4 nights at this central hotel just off the rambla, the rooms were very clean and quiet. no noise that others had said in reviews, breakfast was good but better if they had kept stocking up more offten some days it was short of bread. and the two men working on that floor were very short with you if you asked for more bread or toast and never gave a smile. but all other staff were nice and would give you a good morning. bit noisy if you lave the windows open. would book again as its very central airport train stops at Cataluna and is very short walk down La Rambla to hotel, very central to all places of intrest

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Illinoisresident
Reviews.Content: We liked this Hotel, rooms were big, modern and clean. Free internet and luggage storage. Conveniently located next to a huge Church, walking distance to restaurants, shops, Metro train and the Liceu Opera house, tour bus stops, etc. Only negative is that receptionist doesn't speak English well and rude. Overall, will stay here again and definitely recommed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jWBurns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be convenient to all the major sites in downtown Barcelona. Our room was very clean, and we took advantage of the minibar to keep some items we bought at the nearby La Boqueria market. The hotel is very close to the Liceu metro stop, and easy walking distance to almost everything we chose to see. Located a block west of the Rambla, it faces a square that seems to attract some transients at very times of day, but nothing that bothered us. The included breakfast buffet was adequate - nothing fancy - but the coffee machine produced very weak, almost undrinkable coffee. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, lovely hotel will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ali046
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sant Agusti a few years ago and were really pleased with it, however we only booked this holiday a few weeks ago and got the last room available so weren't sure quite what to expect this time. We were not disappointed. We had a lovely attic room, it was full of character, very clean and much more spacious than expected. This hotel is also great because it is very central - just off La Rambla. The hotel itself is very clean and bright. Breakfast is good, from 7.30am - 11am which is great if you have a late night or an early flight! The staff are very pleasant and helpful - we had arrived at 11am and although check-in is not until 3pm it was no problem to leave our bags in the hotel and use the bathroom facilities. I would recommend this hotel for all travellers. We will definately be back for a 3rd visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Annie65SA
Reviews.Content: What one really needs in Barcelona is a good location. It is an amazing place to explore and one does not spend much time in your hotel room. For this purpose the Agusti was perfect! The hotel is very near La Rambla, and only a few metres from the fantastic Boquiera market. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The hotel is good value for money. The cleaning staff were very friendly but the man at reception when we checked late at night was less friendly. The breakfast was disappointing- with no fresh fruit (despite the lovely market a few steps away). and the coffee was undrinkable. But in Barca a good location beats a good breakfast by far. We decided to have breakfast at the market instead. There was a bit of a smell from the square and a few harmless homeless people were hanging about the square- but they went about their own business and did not beg or bother us in any way. I went to Barcelona with my son, and went very well prepared for pickpockets. Instead we found Bracelona to be clean, friendly and safe. We walked in the streets until late at night and never felt unsafe, uneasy or threatened in any way. I would recommend this hotel based on its location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away with my Daughter”
Reviews.Author: alliper65
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip as a birthday surprise for my Daughters 21st. I read the previous reviews after I had booked and started to get a little concerned. I needn't have worried. Our room was clean and comfortable (349) we didn't hear any noise from outside or from other guests. The maids were swift and efficient. I had rinsed through a pair of white linen trousers and put them to dry over the iron railing outside the window, but one of the maids very kindly put an extra towel under them to save them from any marks. Breakfast was a good continental mix, including cold meat, cereal and pastries. Tea, coffee and Juice. All the hotel staff were friendly and even let us use the hotel computer rather than the guest computer so we could print some pre booked tickets for Segrada familia. There were homeless people in the square, but they just chatted amongst themselves and never approached us. This Hotel is idealy situated for Las ramblas, it's clean comfortable and good value, what more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: smuger11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located just off Las Ramblas, Clean rooms and friendly and helpful staff nothing was too much trouble for them. Where we were located in the hotel we could not hear anybody else. They serve a good choice continental breakfast. The hotel is located in a small square which has a church and a bar next door which is recomended, There were homeless people during the day but they did not cause any trouble and kept to themselves, There is a smell of the sewers when you come out the hotel but you get used to it and you have to walk through it to and from the hotel but don't let this put you off. I would come back here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer255068
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this clean, central city hotel. It's location is perfect for a holiday visit with all the amenties one requires for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice elegant hotel, near La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: SThakkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sant Austi for 1 night, before our cruise from Barcelona. Its a nice hotel, next to a church, and only 150 meters from Liceu subway stop, and the La Ramblas. Rooms on 1st floor are the best, especially with balconies that face the church and the street. Renovations are done on Mezzanine and1st Floors. Few relatives who stayed on the 4th floor, found the rooms old and cramped. Overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel near Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: intellego
Reviews.Content: Take a few minutes to read our review from visting Hotel Sant Agusti. We (two persons, adults) stayed at the hotel for four days and lived in a room with one big bed. The room was quite small with a french balcony. The bathroom was big, clean but not very modern. The main room was clean but the bed was like a bench - hard. Our room was ok from a noise perspective (after reading some other comments here on TripAdvisor). The breakfast was ok but being in Spain you could expect much better juice, fresh fruit etc. The staff were friendly but did not speak very much english at all. The best was that the hotel was central and close to Las Ramblas, about 15 minutes walking from Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute, clean and well decorated hotel. Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: JadeyNunn
Reviews.Content: A nice boutique hotel located 30 second stroll from Las Ramblas. Nicely decorated and extremely clean. Rooms aren’t huge, but are big enough (for me and my massive shoe collection). They are well decorated, bright and airy, with good air-con. I agree with certain previous comments about the lack of sound insulation between rooms; although it’s not as bad as some reviews are making out, and I am a VERY light sleeper. Bathrooms are also bright, airy and very clean. The only thing I will mention is that the pillows are quite hard, but that’s just nit picking. Rooms have security safes in, and the key can be obtained from the reception. I would recommend using the safe to keep personal belongings safe whilst out; pick-pockets are renowned in Barcelona! Breakfast was as expected; continental. Nothing spectacular, but did the job. The staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and speak excellent English for those who struggle with Spanish/Catalonian. One thing I did notice when arriving are the homeless people that gather in the large square outside the front of the hotel. They were no bother, didn’t hassle anyone and kept to themselves… I was just wary at first. Other than that, I would definitely visit this hotel again when next visiting Barcelona! P.S. When looking for places to eat, you HAVE to try Los Caracoles (Just off of the Plaza Reial, next to Las Ramblas); if not for the excellent food and wine, for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good position, but take your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: JacquiWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great position just of Los Ramblas and only 10 minutes walk from Catalunya Place, where the Aerobus and Tourist buses stop. Also it is just a stride away from the most wonderful market, you will never believe the array of food on display. The hotel is very basic, the room was a bit grubby on arrival but improved over the 3 days. Laminate flooring makes it quite noisy and as I had read on TripAdvisor, there is no sound insulation between the rooms, you really can hear everything! I had read this before we left and bought some earplugs at the airport. The breakfast was ok, typical continental, but plenty of choice. We tried one of the restaurants recommended by previous travellers, namely La Fonda. This proved to be very good value but get there early to avoid the queue. They also have one at the Olympic Port, we didn't try this one but it looked great. The hotel receptionist was very helpful and on his recommendation we bought a two day ticket for the Tour Bus. This was a very good move. We spent the first day travelling both routes and the second going back to places we wanted to see in more detail. Must sees are the Galle gardens and of course the Gaudi Cathederal, but the queue to get in the Cathederal was huge. Barcelona is a beautiful city and we would like to go back, 4 days was not enough. March is a perfect time to go as the trees are not in leaf and you can see the sites much better without the leaves blocking the views. We would use this hotel again, but would ask for a 3rd floor room and make sure we packed our earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, average experience”
Reviews.Author: mlvp45
Reviews.Content: The big plus of this hotel is the location, very near to La Rambla and only a ten minute walk from one of the tourist bus stops. The staff is very friendly, they try hard to speak English. The decoration of the lobby was nice, and the hallways looked nice and modern. Our room was simple and had a good size. The two negative points are the the beds (matress was way too hard and made noise) and the sound level. We were lucky not the sleep on the plaza side, so we had no problems at all with the noise from outside. We could however hear entire conversations from our neighbours. Sound isolation from the badroom was also poor. Another negative point is the fact that there was no information available inside the room on stuff like the restaurant menu and check out time. Breakfast was simple but good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Night service very poor...”
Reviews.Author: MFA80
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel location and the rooms. It's perfect if you want to visit the city, really in the heart of Barrio Gotico, 2 mins from Ramblas and 2 mins from the metro. The rooms are very big and modern with all you need really. During the day we asked twice indications about how to get to places and the service was amazing! The same person also helped us on the last day to load the car. Really nice! What is sad is that the service during the night is absolutely terrible. We called the hotel at 4am because we were lost and the answer was "well, you're still a bit far, it will be difficult". Also when we asked about parking, and got the same amazing answer that "it will be difficult to park in Barcelona" just to find out later that there are at least 4 parkings just around the corner. Also the daily service was not great. Everyday we had to ask to shower gel and we never heard a "sorry here you have..." all we got was "here!" like someone was making us a favor. All in all I would recommend this hotel but I really encourage the management to change the night shift and "train" some of the cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: EzzyLuton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location, just a minutes walk and you are on Las Ramblas. Rooms were clean and the maid came in everyday to make the beds etc. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. The only problem we had was the very thin walls.....you could hear absolutely everything, every cough, sneeze and flush of the loo! We didn't have a problem with pickpocketing and the people that hung around the square outside the hotel in the day time were gone by nightfall. The only thing that lets this hotel down is the noise from your neighbours!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the bad and and the Agusti”
Reviews.Author: alasn
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: Pleasant building in a convenient and central location. Clean and pleasantly decorated. Now for the bad bits: Walls in our room very thin - could hear discussions next door all too clearly. Toiletries consisted of one mini bottle of shampoo which was never replenished - basic or what? Our room was tiny 6-7 feet wide. TV pictures all poor with only Spanish stations. Radio with ceiling speaker had just three statiions. Breakfast varied service - on first morning no cleared tables, no knives and lots of food missing, people arguing with staff over facilities - subsequent mornings much better. Drunks and homeless outside in square most nights. Pretty hard beds - most of our room (216) was just a bed! With better management and a little more thought this could be a great hotel - pity our experience was hit and miss. The San Agusti's situation is great - especially if you like being close to the centre of things and the edge that proximity to the Ravel and Ramblas bring. If you could only ensure a reasonable sized room (unlike the one we got (more of a corridor) and hopefully quiet neighbours this could be a reasonable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jaymont
Reviews.Content: Good - Location to Las Ramblas and Liceu metro Bad - Rooms , the walls were so thin i could hear every conversation, activity my neighbours were engaging in. Every burp, fart and snore sounded like it was in the room with us. There was no room information at all from instructions on how to use the telephone , TV or fire regulations \ exits. Lucky we were not in a room on the square like the other people in our group who also had contend with noise coming from square too. The mattress and pillows appeared to have been left behind by the Nun's when they moved out. Breakfast - If you like jam on toast , insipid old scrabbled eggs and bad machine coffee and orange juice this is the place for you. Lobby - Furnished with old dirty IKEA rugs and chairs. Immediately outside - one of two groups of individuals liked to frequent the square at whatever time of day 1) Local drunks, 2) Youths or alleged workers wearing louminous jackets playing football. Staff - Cultural differences aside and I am spanish the the cup was half empty surrounding even the simplest request. In short don't choose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: lloleper
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening and for the first night got a small room , but the next morning asked to have a better room and the manager accomodated us . Very clean and adeguate breakfast . For a few days a perfect place to stay no luxuries at all !

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the City”
Reviews.Author: RuthieBangor_NI
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in a group of 5 girlfriends. Hotel allocated us adjoining rooms which was good for us but possibly wouldn't work for others if some were night owls and others were early birds. The rooms were adjoining but only one door which accessed the first bedroom with 3 single beds, then through glass doors to a separate room with 2 single beds. Each had its own bathroom which was great considering there were 5 girlies trying to get ready at the same time! Location was excellent, approx 100 yds from Las Ramblas and only a stroll from La Boqueria. We had Room 237 which was a bit noisy. We were the first room on the corridor and could hear everyone passing plus right next door to the laundry room plus the waterworkings of the hotel sounded like Niagra Falls in our room for some reason from those rooms above us. Read reviews about homeless people loitering around the square outside the hotel but in no way felt vulnerable. Noticed a few guys hanging around but more conscious of the pick pocketers out on Las Ramblas. Thankfully we didn't fall victim to that but be on your guard - there are suspicious looking characters and they are just eying up their prey - you can see them right before your eyes! La Boqueria was fantastic so fresh fruit a plenty of the most tasty fruit drinks - my favourite, coconut and strawberry. 48-hr ticket for hop-on-hop-off bus is excellent value and well worth the tour. Don't rush off to see the Magic Fountains though as they are apparently out of order until November - no one told us so we made out way over like many others only to be disappointed. Metro T10 ticket is worth the buy - 10 journeys for just under 8 Euros. We were able to use it for our 5 return journeys fo the Fountains so it's not limited to one person's use. All in all, would definitely stay in this hotel again - great little spot with excellent breakfast and if you like costume jewellery, there's at least half a dozen shops you'll enjoy browsing round.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Roamingdolly
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes an ideal base for exploring Barcelona. It is a 10 - 15 minute walk from Catalunya where the Aerobus arrives and departs. Walk down the Ramblas on the r/hand side and take the turning into Carrer de Hospital just after the wonderful market (LaBoqueria) and it is in a quiet square 100 yards on your left. It is within very easy reach of the Marina and the old town area. The Liceu Metro stop is at the end of the road. If you arrive early (check in is 2pm) there is a room to leave luggage. The hotel has a restaurant and the evening meal looked reasonable value for a basic menu. We had no problems with the men who seem to frequent the square during the day and evening and we (two females) were never approached by them and there was no sign of them late at night. The bedroom was a reasonable size with a good bathroom and the beds were comfortable. There is a room safe - you pay a small daily charge as well as paying a returnable deposit for the key. We had an internal room which could be stuffy at times but OK if the window was left open. Instructions for the Aircon would have been helpful. Breakfasts were adequate - but some fresh fruit would have been welcome. I agree with comments about the dour gentleman at breakfast but give him a smile and he will reciprocate! 9am - 9.30am is very busy so tables fill up quickly. Buses leave from Catalunya Square to various places of interest but we found it difficult to work out from which stop each service actually went from. There is a tourist booth on the Square and they will help. If you get a T-10 ticket this is for 10 single journies on the Metro or buses. Very good value as 2 people can use the same ticket - just put it in the machine twice as you get on the bus. (Get on at the front and out in the middle). El Corte Ingles have a huge store on Catalunya - go to the top for a reasonable priced snack/meal and look over the city for wonderful views. Also check out their supermarket in the basement. Don't go to restaurants on the Ramblas - they are touristy and overpriced. A few yards off the main thoroughfare will lead you to many smaller establisments with much better food but be aware that many do not open until 9pm in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Dennis185
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, couldn't believe how effective the double glazing was when closed to get rid of the street noise. Bedrooms were adequate but walls were a bit thin to the neighbours bathroom. No kettle meant we missed a 'brew ' in the morning Didn't have any problems with anyone in the square outside and always made our way without any interuption onto La Rambla day or night. Enjoyed breakfast although my BH would have liked some fruit. Staff were always helpful but language can be a barrier, I don't speak Spanish or Catalan!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMariaB87
Reviews.Content: Considering the relatively low price of this hotel, the location is fantastic. It is right in the heart of the city, practically on the Ramblas. Almost all of the major sights are within walking distance - Plaza Catalunya, the Old Town and the Harbour. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful, with the exception of the grumpy man who oversaw the breakfasts - I've noticed that he's been mentioned a few times! Lots of people have commented that this hotel is in a dodgy area, but if you're walking from the Ramblas you shouldn't have any problems - we certainly didn't. Having said that, exploring the streets behind the hotel you will see that it's quite a run-down district, but actualy very interesting and atmospheric to explore. It certainly didn't seem 'dangerous' to me - at least not in the daytime. I would definitely stay here again as the location is excellent - and just a short walk from Plaza Catalunya and the airport bus. A train or taxi is really a waste of money as the bus to/from the airport is so regular, cheap and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I think there will be better”
Reviews.Author: myholiday77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights on a short break to Barcelona. The Hotel is ideally situated just off Las Ramblas and is therefore close to plenty of tourist attractions or to the bus stops for Day Tours. As some other reviews have said, there were small groups of men in the square outside the hotel who I presume were using the nearby Hostel, however, we never had any problems with them. The Hotel room was clean and the bathroom appeared newly furnised, however, I found the hotel a bit dark -lights seemed to be few and far between and only came on in the corridor when someone moved. There was also quite a bit of noise from the corridors at night due to the wood floor. Breakfast was okay but I wouldn't recommend the fruit juice!

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheshire764
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this hotel and can't believe the negative comments about it. Our room was extremely spacious with separate bathroom from the toilet/bidet. It was all brand new furniture and everything was spotlessly clean. The 3* rating seems a little on the downside - I would rate it a 4". The square outside did seem to attract a group of men congregating, but it was outside the hotel and did not impact upon the hotel at all. It is located close enough from the main road to be within 2 minutes walk, and far enough away to be away from the noise once the balcony doors were shut. The air conditioning was great. I would have no hesitation in recommending or returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “way below par”
Reviews.Author: tani-bird
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the only thing this hotel has going for it is that it is near the ramblas. That said, the short walk between the two is unnerving, especially at night. There are a constant group of people drinking, who seem to have no fixed abode. My husband and I were approached by a man asking us if we wanted some "good stuff." There is a low lingering stench at particluar times in the hotel, including the bedroom. I think its due to a poor sewage system. The towels are thin and an off white color. The room we stayed in was tiny with blue MDF type furniture. The breakfast is bland and boring. They really should provide fresh fruit and drinkable coffee. The thing that we found most annoying was the complete lack of internal (no external noise) soundproofing. I really did feel like the couple next door to us were staying in our bedroom!!! We heard far too much! The corridors are so noisy. The wifi access was great!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for short stay!”
Reviews.Author: StephsH
Reviews.Content: Me and my OH stayed at the Sant Agusti Hotel for 3 nights. We were pleasantly greeted outside the Hotel by a homeless man relieving himself against a tree........word of warning, if you wear sandals watch where you walk as they just pee in the square outside the hotel. The hotel room was very basic but fine for 3 nights in Barca. Small balcony overlooked the square and provided my OH with hours of entertainment watching the beggars arguing. They don't bother the tourists but fight amongst themselves....from our balcony we watched one man beat another with a metal pole and watched the ambulance take a very battered looking man away. (Not a suitable hotel for children!) Hotel staff could definately be more friendly and softer pillows would prevent serious neck pain during the night! Overall, good location but would definately try to find somewhere better to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: furnitureboy
Reviews.Content: 19th August 2010 I read the reviews before staying in St Agusti and we were pleasantly surprised as there seemed to be some quite negative comments. The hotel is very well located off Las Ramblas which has many restaurants, bars, metro, etc. The hotel is situated in a square just off the main street which is frequented by homeless and some undesirables. I did get asked if I wanted drugs 'want charlie good stuff' etc just the once and we kept walking and they left us alone. The room was clean, modern, with cable TV (BBC World News only English speaking channel). Bed was big but hard and hard pillows not to our taste...... Breakfast was very good - 2 types of cereal, toast, yogurts, bread rolls, cold meats, cheese, jams, scrambled egg with sausages, tea, coffee, juices (a little too sweet) get there fairly early before 8.30 am as it starts to get busy but not a problem Staff did answer our questions when we asked for information. All in all we really enjoyed our time in Barcelona and that included staying in this hotel. My advice would be:- >Buy a ticket for the Sightseeing buses and travel around the city picking out the sites you want to spend time at. Gaudi sites, Camp Nou, Cable Car etc... >Be alert to pickpockets etc think Oxford Street and you will be fine. >Placa Reial off Las Ramblas is a pretty square to visit and eat but beware it is rife with thieves, we watched BBC programme Secret Tourist which filmed a bag snatch (set up) from this square and if you follow the tips in this programme you should be fine. e.g. don’t put your handbag on a chair put the chair leg through the handle of the bag. Be alert to who is around you. >We loved Barcelona and it was up there with our trip to Paris so enjoy the hotel and more importantly enjoy Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahBristol
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona. We have been to this beautiful city a couple of times now and stayed in three hotels all siturated on / near Las Ramblas. Hotel Sant Augusti was far better than we had expected and excellent value for money. We requested a room with a balcony which they gave us. The room was spacious (room 362) and overlooked the small square outside and you could here the lovely singing in the church next door. Room - good size and very clean / newly decorated. Staff - very helpful. Location - just off the Ramblas and good soundproofing. Would we go back - most definately! Out of the three hotels we have stayed in definately the best so far....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: musicteachjc
Reviews.Content: Arrived in mid morning for a 2 night stay and we were able to get in the room almost immediately. The staff helped us find local attractions we could walk to and then gave directions to the tourist bus, which we took everywhere. Rooms were clean, comfortable, modern with great air conditioning We had 2 balconies in a corner room - the windows shut out the late night noise. Breakfast - juice, coffee, tea, rolls, pastry, eggs, sausage, yogurt, cold meat and cheese. We purchased snacks, fruit and wine at the market which is 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “We would book again tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: joynsteve
Reviews.Content: The San AGusti is in a little square 40 m off the Ramblas, 5mins from Placa Ctalunya and the same from the port. We had a nice view over the square with small balcony( do not be put off by suggestions that homeless people use it ) . Dinner is offered but there are small places to eat favoured by the Spanish very close. Metro and tour buses are close but much can be seen on foot.. Soundproofing was really good so peaceful nights.Breakfst fine, free internet was often in use.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, pity about grumpy staff”
Reviews.Author: HippoLondon
Reviews.Content: My daughter (15) and I spent 4 idyllic days in Barcelona. The Sant Agusti hotel is located ideally - just of La Ramblas and cheek by jowl with the Boqueria .... What more could a girl want? We'd have loved a friendly face to greet us at reception. Breakfast is served in lovely lightfilled rooms (bare stone walls down one side) and overlooking the Placa plus with a terrace/smoking area. Reception area is also pleasant and there's a computer for internet use. Our room was perfectly suitable and the bathroom facilities were well used on such balmy July days/evenings. I'd give this hotel another try even given our small gripe as it's just so centrally located that you really do get to experience Barcelona like a local as well as a tourist. When in Barcelona - do make an effort to get down to La Barceloneta - the beach. Unexpectedly wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in overpriced city”
Reviews.Author: mel51
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel in a triple room with our pre-uni daughter. We had a good room overlooking the road and the buildings opposite. We found the mattresses extremely firm, but that was the only small gripe of the stay. Breakfast was first class and all the staff were efficient and friendly. Location was excellent for our requirements as we found the hotel was close to all transport systems and only two minutes walk from the main transport hub of Place de la Catalunya. Prices are very high in this area, the cheapest light meal that we could find at lunchtimes were still very expensive, i.e. Three half-baguettes with melted cheese topping and two pints of Sangria was the equivilent of £43.. be aware of drink prices, they are often not mentioned on menu's and are sometimes used to hike the total price, it is not unusual, on asking for the bill, to find that you ae charged 3,4 or even £5 for a soft drink. All this is only a small detraction from a wonderful city. Go and enjoy!.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, even better breakfast”
Reviews.Author: paulc64
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and although we arrived at 2am the first night due to plane disruption everything was handled beautifully once we arrived at the hotel. Thankfully, breakfast is served until 11am so we could have a lie-in and still get to have breakfast; a lovely buffet breakfast, Juice, coffee, yoghurt, toast, croissants, ham/salamis, cheese, scrambled egg, franfurters, assorted rolls. I'm the sort of bloke who has 3 breakfasts and no lunch so I was in my element. My partner bemoaned the fact there was no fresh fruit. Rooms were great with flatscreen TV, bathrooms modern and clean. And all cleaned, as you would expect, daily and to a high stndard. Barcelona can be noisy late into the night but we slept well (cos we walk for miles during the day?). Council garbage trucks can be noisy and we had noisy neighbours one night that we could hear clearly. So if your neighbours are quiet the place is pretty well quiet. Yes, a handful of people who have fallen on hard times do linger at a meeting point about 40 yards from the hotel entrance but not one ever asked for a cent or raised a gesture of aggression. They probably hope to get a handout from the church next door to the hotel. You are a hundred yards from La Rambla but could be a mile when you are in the hotel. Yet when you want La Rambla you are there in a minute. 10 minute sue south walk to the harbour with the boats and another 10 minutes to the beach, 5 mins north to Plaza Catalunya. All in all, excellent value at 85 Euros a night(double room) with unlimited breakfast in the heart of Barcelonas tourist district.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LynMWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after our cruise on the Costa Concordia. It was quite a drive with the taxi as it is just off the centre of Las Ramblas and there is a one-way road system in place. Once we arrived we were greeted in English and given the times of dinner and breakfast. Our room was E08 and would recommend that you ask for this room as it overlooks the Plaze of Sant Agusti and is exceptionally large, the french doors are double glazed so there is no noise from the Plaza except when the restaurant below is putting away their tables and chairs, try this for lunch (on the right of the main hotel entrance) excellent value for money. The hotel is just off the centre of Las Ramblas, right where a visitor would want to be and is excellent value for money. We ordered an early morning call and a taxi and both arrived on time, the staff were courteous at all times and very knowledgable about Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous location, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: portlandorer
Reviews.Content: Maybe a block off the Rambla and barely more than that to a subway station, this very clean, updated hotel is quite a value. It includes a typical European breakfast of scrambled eggs (moist as opposed to dried out), cold cuts and cheese, juice (well, more like drink). Rooms differ a fair amount, particularly with respect to the bathrooms (due to circumstances with flight difficulties we stayed in 3 different rooms). Almost all have little balconies. The location is amazingly quiet as there is almost no vehicular traffic on this street and there are thermalpane windows. It´s downtown, so don´t expect a pristine environment, but it´s on a decent little square. The middle aged men who staff the front desk could use some (well maybe a lot of) charm school, but they speak decent English and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We will book this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: maggi06 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was friendly,good choice of breakfast, we had dinner one night which was very reasonable and good. The location was minutes from the Las Rambles. We would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireMinnie
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends had a girls weekend to Barcelona and chose this hotel because of value for money and reviews read on this website. As a group of girls, we never felt under threat in any way shape or form and can hardly believe half the reviews we read. It is on a square where down and outs gather but they certainly never bothered us. It would make the area more attractive if they weren't there but we were hardly there long enough to be constant observers. The hotel is within easy walking distance of lots to see and do, behind the La Bouchires market. Great location. Lovely bar/restaurent beside the hotel,BLUE,which you wouldn't believe exsited in the day as it's all shut up but comes to life at night. We ate there twice. We asked the receptionist for recommendations for lunch and dinner and he sent us to a fabulous tapas on the opposite of La Rambla for lunch and another restaurant, behind this again, for dinner. Can't remember the names of either!!but receptionist will tell you and give you a map. All in all a fab time had by all, so much so that a return trip to the same hotel is being planned for this year.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: VanKimi
Reviews.Content: As most reviews have stated, the location of the hotel is good but I would suggest that you consider paying another 10-20 Euros per night at one of the many other hotels in the Ramblas area that do not have homeless people living in the square out front and do not need to lock and monitor their door at night. We did not expect much for breakkfast but it is too basic and never changes, there was no fresh fruit even though there is a large fresh food market around the corner. The beds are too hard, we had tiny ants in our room and the walls in the breakfast room were literally dirty. The front desk staff all desperately need training in customer service, no exceptions. I was with two friends, one of whom is fluent in Spanish, unbeknownst to a frusturated housekeeper, when we were in search of a room with more comfortable beds. If I was the owner of this hotel I would be very concerned and invest in some quality staff with a focus on customer service to better represent this property. It is a pity that the charming idea of a remodelled convent is not delivered; I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big breakfast, decent service”
Reviews.Author: TheParrothead
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value. Big, all you can eat breakfast was enough to get us through to dinner. The service was average, and the rooms clean. Beds were pretty stiff, but not much more than the average European fare. Windows opened to a nice square, and it was wonderful to leave them open until bedtime. After that, you need to close them to get sleep with the sounds of the city left outside. Even for a light sleeper, it was easy to get to sleep. You couldn't ask for a better location in Barcelona. One block off Las Ramblas, just a skip away from the metro station. Just a note on Barcelona...we had one close call with a pick-pocket, but managed to get through without losing anything. Keep your eye on people hanging out by the metro entrance gates. Don't keep anything valuable within easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key”
Reviews.Author: Bantamspaul
Reviews.Content: Sant Agusti is a reasonable-sized budget hotel but location (right next to Las Ramblas) is first class. Staff were ok though there was a small contretemps on our last night when we got stuck in the lift. Public areas are a little tired but rooms are of a reasonable size and beds were comfy enough. The buffet breakfast was ok - watered-down fruit juice and inedible scrambled eggs aside - and served right up until 1100. There are a few vagrants around the square but we had no bother from them, however, Las Ramblas can get extremely busy and one should keep a tight grip on valuables especially late at night as you can get manhandled. Generally though Barcelona is fantastic but pricey and, sadly, has more than its fair share of graffiti. ~Make sure you taking the cable car up to Montjuic for some great views of the city

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: zekenz
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at Hotel Sant Agusti. Again we were very happy with the location of this hotel. The staff were friendly and spoke great english. (which helped as I can only speak a little spanish) We had a late flight out and they let us keep our bags locked away on that day and had no problem with us popping in and out to grab things and drop things off. The breakfast was good, bread, pastries, a selection of meats, cheese, yoghurt, cereal, fruit and some hot stuff too. Internet is free on a computer in lobby. Yes there are some wineo's in the square but i never felt threatened or bothered by it. My only gripe, and it is just a small one, is that I booked 6 months in advance and was given a loft room when I requested a balcony room, which was just as nice but it would have been nice to see the street. Other than that we were very happy and would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel, no complaints for the budget traveller.”
Reviews.Author: kerryguy82
Reviews.Content: This 3-star hotel was booked for my sister and I in a travel agent package, and after a nightmare experience in a cheap London hotel, I wasn't sure what to expect. Firstly, the location is perfect, just off the bustling Rambla and within five minutes walk of Liceu metro. The manager and his staff were pleasant and efficient, thankfully we didn't require their services too often, but they happily booked our taxi to the airport. No complaints about the breakfast, hearty portions of scrambled eggs, salami, sausages, cereal, bread, coffee, juice and yoghurt were available for free, so filling up will see you through until mid-afternoon. Also free Internet wasavailable in the lobby, though an extra computer would be ideal to cope with the demand. What brought the rating down to a 4 (3.5 really, but this wasn't possible) was trouble sleeping, as the people next door had the TV on all night, and the square seems to be the gathering place for local winos. All things considered though, it was a most enjoyable hotel, ideal for travellers seeking bargain lodgings, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A small but very handy hotel in the heart of the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: DevonMargaret
Reviews.Content: A basic but perfectly clean and tidy hotel, perfect for a city break. Breakfast was fairly basic but in a city full of food it was enough to start the day. Some vagabonds did hang around outside in the square but they got marched on and they really didn't bother anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Madwife59
Reviews.Content: My three friends & I celebrated our Golden Birthdays in this fabulous city. The hotel was ideal as it is literally one minute walk on to the Ramblas and for just walking and wondering up and down the Ramblas and people watching. Breakfast was more than adequate with both hot and cold food available. We went and bought boxes of mixed fruits from the Main Market next door for 1.5 Euro which kept us going on the Guide Tour bus of the city. Rooms were clean and tidy and all the hotel staff were very friendly, pleasant and polite. The two bars in the square were good and the one next to the Church served good cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jmum
Reviews.Content: Great location, just of La Rambla and in two minutes walk of the reat Metro system - don't forget to buy a "book" of 10 tickets that you can use on the metro and on the buses. You can go to the same places as the tour buses and at a fraction of the cost. The hotel faces onto Placa San Augusti and yes there are some down and outs that frequent the square - probably because the church provides free meals for them - but we did not find them threatening. The rooms are good with plenty of space and a comfy bed. The soundproofing is not great, but if you read these reviews, you come armed with some ear plugs! Breakfast was more than adequate. Cereals, yoghurts, variety of bread, cold cuts and cheese and a hot dish too. I agree the juice is awful, but have found similar all over southern Europe. Fresh fruit would have been good and with a fantastic market almost next door it would not have been too difficult to provide. Overall a good hotel at a good price in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AR123Scotland
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel, I thought it was a very good standard of accomodation for a 3* The rooms were trendy and very clean and the breakfast was good. The location is fab as is just a few mins walk from la rambla. I would def stay here again if I go back to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bb12
Reviews.Content: We must have got the same rude night guy as a previous reviewer.The lady on in the morning was very helpful.The room was small and unfortunately we were overlooking the suare with all the vagrants and seedy characters who finally leave or sleep about 1 am.The walls are paperthin and the bed was hard as a slab of marble.We heard the guy snoring in the next room ,lucky man.The oj is watered down and breaky basic so overall i see why this place is well down list on tripadvisor.Its central but thats its best feature.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Break”
Reviews.Author: dramaineducation
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short winter break in this hotel. The ambience was pleasant, the rooms clean and the staff helpful and friendly. There were some problems with the air-conditioning but this was rectified swiftly when reported. We ate in the restaurant every night and though the menu was limited, it was inexpensive and appetising. During some evenings, a large party of French school students shared the dining room but they were well-behaved and we felt quite lonely when they left. Comments about the square outside the hotel being unsavoury at night may have been true but we saw nothing of which to be overly fearful and the square is well lit and quiet. Perhaps it may be different during the summer months. The hotel is well-placed midway on the Ramblas and well connected to tour buses and the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good without being spectatcular”
Reviews.Author: Greatscots
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a four day break. The hotel is on a small square two minutes walk from Las Ramblas so is very central. There are some vagrants hanging about but the police move them on very quickly. The rooms are small but very clean and the hotel staff are very helpful. The price paid reflects the standard but is more than matched by the hotel's location to Catalunya Square, Las Ramblas and the Port Area. Check our the bar next door - Rita Blue- for food and drinks, very reasonalble.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: kaz37Somerset
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing long weekend with my partner in Barcelona staying at the Hotel Sant Agusti. We decided to upgrade to one of the attic rooms for 20 euros each. The room was a good size with authentic beams, very clean and had excellent views over the Barcelona rooftops. Breakfast was rather basic, but there was plenty of it, buffet style. The location is simply excellent, very quiet and right next to La Ramblas and the Liceu metro station. We could walk from the hotel to many of the Barcelona attractions or take the metro if feeling lazy. I would recommend you do not go to the bars on La Ramblas as they are very expensive. There are plenty of side streets with much cheaper bars and restaurants around Plaza Catalunya or further afield. I would recommend this hotel, particularly because of the fantastic location and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowHolidayD
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from the san agustin hotel. Myself and 7 girlfriends went for a girly trip for my "Hen Do". The hotel was very central which was great and the rooms were clean and had everything we required. The man who greeted us on our arrival was very helpful and pleasant, all in all a great start! The first evening after our night out we were greeted with a very unfriendly, rude nightshift worker called"john", he screemed at us to keep the noise down (we are from glasgow and have loud voices but were in no way being noisy) told us we had no respect, which really offended us as we had done nothing wrong, we shrugged this off and thought be bigger than him and dont complain, so the 2 nd evening we came in the same nightshift worker was working he didnt look in our direction when we were waiting on the lift, a client of the hotel came in with a prostitute (we had passed them at the corner of the hotel and seen them agree a deal) it disgusted me so i went to the nightshift worker and told him i didn't feel comfortable with a hotel that allows solicitation, he told be in a rude manner that there was nothing he could do, he couldn't beat the client up and we had to put up with this! I began to feel unsafe in the hotel knowing that this was going on, outside the hotel there was lots of down and outs and about 6 prostitute's that stood 100meters away, openly making deals with punters, they were very intimating and a few of them stood in our way pushing against us, which terrified our group. On the last evening one of our group got her purse stole outside the hotel. Overall the hotel was very central to las ramblas, reasonable priced and clean but the cons out do the pros which was bad attitude from unfriendly staff and an unsafe feeling outside the hotel, we all felt pretty vulnerable.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as it could be !!!”
Reviews.Author: dissapointed63
Reviews.Content: we arrived late at night, 1 lift being replaced, the other out of order, had to carry all luggage up 3 flights of stairs, no offer of assistance. we stayed 5 days, lift still not working when we checked out. We expected an old hotel with lots of feature's, everything has be modernised very dissapointing. there was dirty marks on the bathroom floor, thick dust on top of toilet cistern, towel holders, and shower curtain rail, the shower head also needed de scaling. the tiles & mirror above the sink was splattered with toothpaste. and a very strong smell of drain's. the toiletries provided were totally inadiquate for two people. One of the bedside light bulbs was not working, it still had not been replaced by check out day. the room did not have any tea/coffee making facility, nor did it have any bottle water & glass's, we had a late check in and the bar was already closed, two tired and thirsty guest's had to wait until breakfast for refreshments although breakfast is served until 11am, and was very simple, there was plenty to eat, the oj tasted as if it had been watered down, the staff 'hover' around which made us feel uncomfortable if we lingered longer to finnish the meal. However we were very close to the Rumbles and the metro

Reviews.Title: “Completely lacking in character - very poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: WoodyYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sant Agusti 18 and 19 September 2008: The Hotel Sant Agusti is very poor value for money. It is allegedly the oldest hotel in Barcelona and is situated just off Las Ramblas yet has absolutely no character whatsoever. It has been modernised into a featureless, anodyne block of bedrooms - you could be anywhere in the world. The rooms are modern but ours had very noisy air conditioning. The bathroom facilities are poor. The shower was only a dribble, the towels were less than white and thin. The breakfast was very poor quality - no fresh fruit and very limited choice of bread, cheese, meat and cooked items. We stayed earlier in the year at the Hotel Principal in the next street to the Sant Agusti. That is a far superior hotel in every way. I would not stay at Hotel Sant Agusti again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel Close To The Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: britannia_view
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during August 2008. As recommended on another website we arranged to upgrade the room to an attic room. This room was very clean, spacious and had good views across the roof tops of Barcelona. The square outside did have some vagrants hanging around but the police presence kept them in check. A very clean, friendly hotel that is less than 2 minutes walk from Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chachaEngland
Reviews.Content: This comfortable 3 star hotel is situated just off Las Ramblas in the heart of Barcelona. It is off the main street up a quiet avenue so is not noisy at night. The hotel is perfectly located near to the metro station and tourist bus attractions, as well as it being within walkig distance of many places of interest. It is only a short walk to the harbour of Port Vell which is perfect if you want to sit at a cafe/restaurant and enjoy the bustle of this city. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are perfectly air conditioned - much needed in the summer months! The staff are friendly and helpful and the food at breakfast is simple yet nice. Had a really enjoyable stay at this hotel and on my return to Barcelona I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel ideally situated- shame about down and outs in square”
Reviews.Author: CazBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights- Excellent situation just off Las Ramblas, not noisey- Very clean and tidy. Lovely feel to breakfast room which although quite modern has some nice old features felt very bright and airy. Very basic breakfast though- no good if you enjoy a full fry up !! Only shame was the square outside which had alot of 'down and outs' hanging around from early morning until late at night. Went as a couple and we were not too late home can imagine if part of a girlie group might be a bit intimidating going back to hotel on your own as apparently quite well known for mugging and pick pocketing. We had no problems but felt you did need to keep your wits about you, shame really as otherwise fab place to stay (better policing of the square might overcome the problem.)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: moodycow
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel twice. i took my mum there in 2007 and my boyfriend in 2008. on both occassions the hotel was excellent. the location is fantastic!. the staff are helpful, and the rooms are roomy for a city hotel and the bathroom was roomy and the shower very good. breakfast was a buffet style and fine, the coffee was awful though!.

Reviews.Title: “Please get some soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: Schnapped
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great - extremely easy to find after taking the bus from the airport to Placa de Catalunia. Good location to see the sites from. No hassle from the homeless people outside the hotel whatsoever. Staff pleasant and helpful. Room clean. Breakfast good. The only downside we found was the complete lack of soundproofing in the room. It's a shame but we wouldn't stay here again because of that.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: martygill
Reviews.Content: 20th wedding anniversary, 5 nights, perfect! Clean room, quiet at night, good sleep, brilliantly adjustable air con. Free safe in room. Good range of help yourself breakfast. Friendly, helpful reception staff. Room to leave kit on last day. Aero-bus straight outside terminal to Placa de Catalunia, five minute walk to hotel down Las Ramlas taking in all the atmosphere! Plenty of people are towing a case at any given time, you don't stand out! Taking the bus means you see everything and overall the journey time is short (35-45 minutes) and cheap, 3 euro something each, each way. All but door to door! Rita Blue, the bar / restaurant next door vibrant, energetic yet welcoming with friendly staff. The square is used by less fortunate people to hang around in but we never felt unsafe or hassled whatsoever. A peaceful place with a church forming one side of the square. Seconds to Las Ramblas, minutes to the waterfront, 20 minutes to the beaches (on foot of course!). Would we go back again? A big YES!

Reviews.Title: “Take our advice and go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: wickhamhenwoman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights staying at Sant Augusti Hotel, Barcelona. The hotel is in a square, just off La Rambla, so good for accessing the sights. A dismal area which managed to escape the sun all day. The square was full of old vagrants from about 7am, swigging alcohol and at night the queue for the hostel opposite seemed to consist of male immigrants look for somewhere to sleep, quite intimidating. There is a heavy police presence day and night - I don't know if that is reassuring or not. Reported to be one of the oldest hotels in the city you would be hard pressed to find any old world charm left in this place. Whereas the facade gives a hint of what it was like, once inside it is a bland modern space with no atmosphere. The first room we were given was so dirty and cramped. The air conditioning switch and other electrical fittings were hanging off the wall, the bathroom walls and tiles were mouldy. We asked to be moved and we were put in a room which was kitted out for disabled travellers. A larger room, still shabby but at least it was clean. The walls are paper thin, we were treated to loud music all evening on our first night then shouting at around 4am as the boys in the next room to us returned from their night out. They disconnected our key at one point so we couldn't get into our room! The lift is scary, shakey and the doors take an age to open and is best avoided, particularly if you are not really fond of lifts. The staff were decidedly unfriendly. They never looked up from the reception desk when you came through the front doors - a little worrying at night as you could be anyone entering the building. Handing in our key on departure was met with a grunt! The breakfast - same every day. Stale croissants, bread, more bread pretending to be brioche, cake, 2 large lumps of scrambled egg in a metal container and hot dog sausages cut up into small pieces - did you see the programme Jamie Oliver did about mechanically recovered meat?! The coffee was absolutely disgusting and we tried every combination out of the machine to see if we could get a decent cup. The dining room was lit by what can only be described as industrial lighting - how many halogen spot lights do you need in a room? They must have got a job lot! Our advice would be not to stay here but choose another hotel in a central location, even if it costs you a little more. Barcelona itself is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, vibrant city.”
Reviews.Author: montyzuma
Reviews.Content: The Sant Agusti is purported to be the oldest hotel in Barcelona. For all that it is of a good standard with the facilities of a hotel in the 21st century. The staff were friendly from the receptionist through to the breakfast attendees. Rooms - basic but clean and comfortable. Yes there is a little noise - mostly from cleaning staff on a morning but nothing to cause major irritation. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the street. This was great for watching the comings and goings of this lively, vibrant city. Because the room was double glazed and with shutters none of the street noise affected sleep during the night. The square in which the hotel is located does have its fair share of "down at heels" so those of a "sensitive" need to be aware. However we never experienced any problems or none that one would not come across in any large city. Location, close to La Ramblas and the underground is excellent for exploring. Close by and within a short walk are plentiful shops, restuarants and bars. This was my first time in Barcelona. A fantastic city. Be warned - you will hardly scratch the surface in a 2-3 day visit. I would recommend a week minimum and would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Victorine1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Sant Agusti for four long nights. As per other reviews, internal walls are paper thin (although soundproofing to outside was excellent). Our room on the 1st floor was small but clean. However there was regular whiffs of a nasty sewer smell which made the room uncomfortable to spend much time in. Bed and pillows were uncomfortable. The breakfast was very ordinary with sugar added to just about everything - bread, cornflakes, even the croissants. Eggs were made of powder and the sausages of sawdust. I wouldn't stay here again - there are lots of other hotels equally well placed.

Reviews.Title: “got robbed in front of the hotel. Hotel locked their doors on us.”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonaexperience
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel inside. However, they should use some of their profits and invest in a bellman or better yet a security guard. The hotel is indeed 50 meters off Las Ramblas but the passage to the hotel is a bit sketchy. Myself and 5 girlfriends (all staying at the hotel) were attacked and one was successfully robbed in the alleyway to the hotel and one was actually attacked again as she tried to get to the hotel for safety. The hotel locked its sliding glass doors on us as they saw the commotion and as my friend was struggling with 2 robbers on the ground over her purse. After beating on the doors and the robbers ran off, the reception opened the doors and afterwards provided very little help. It seems to me the hotel has seen this kind of thing rather often and may even have a policy of locking its doors. If I could give the hotel a negative rating, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Area surrounding hotel is unsavory - please read my review”
Reviews.Author: usuktraveler
Reviews.Content: Myself and five female friends stayed at this hotel to celebrate New Years. In the square in front of the hotel we were attacked and the men hanging around the square made many violent attempts to steal our handbags. The night manager of the desk witnessed this happening, did nothing and kept the front glass doors locked until we banged on them, begging to be let in. The night manager would do nothing to ensure our safety and we got a typical mediterean shrug when we asked him to notify authorities, as two other women were attacked in the square while we were at the desk. Barcelona is a big city with big city problems but the treatment of the staff and proximity of the hotel to unsavory areas of Barcelona mean that this hotel should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay in an ideal position”
Reviews.Author: foxypair
