Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the end of April 07.Booked as a package break for four days.Contacted the hotel direct later on and upgraded to one of the Attic rooms,glad we did as this was spacious with a rooftop view. In all we found the hotel very clean and tidy,We had breakfast there and found the food ok. Had read reports that the food was rubbish and the hotel too ! Its just a short walk the Las Ramblas,less than 100 mertres really. Other reports tell of the many vagrants in the Square, they are no problem ! Take the Areobus from the Airport to Placa de Catalunya then one Metro stop to Liceu. We walked for the bus on return, would say its about 300 metres ! The hotel is in an ideal position, you can walk to many places from here. We would not hesitate to stay here again.We also found the Tourist Buses very good and had a two day pass,its good value.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SUEPOPPET
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off La Ramblas in a fabulous location; close to the fantastic food market, loads of bars and restaurants, and shops. The lobby and rooms and fully refurbished and in excellent condition being clean with modern decor. But, and there is a but [!!!], they refurb is cheap and they have used laminate floors and I would assume absolutely no sound proofing so THE NOISE LEVEL IS LOUD!!! Fine if you are not coming in until the early hours, but if you want an early night [which we did not] forget it! The other problem is in the morning, you can hear the plumbing, every flush, shower and bath emptying, and lots of other activities etc of all those in rooms around you. However, the staff are lovely and breakfast room large, spacious and sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SmithyTyrone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, it was very clean the staff were friendly. There are homeless people who vacate the square outside the hotel all the time but do not bother the hotel guests at all. I would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrss2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay at the Sant Agusti hotel, the taxi from the airport was 45 euros for five of us and only took about 20 mins. The hotel itself was plesant, clean and the staff were o.k...the breakfast was also good. The hotel was in a square were the down and outs seem to congregate but they don't bother you. It was literally a minute walk to Las Ramblas so an ideal central location. The Magic Fountains are a must they were amazing and getting the underground to get there was an experience! All in all we had a really good time.........

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: a&ssussex
Reviews.Content: i had read some of the previous reviews which mentioned the vagrants hanging around the hotel and imagined the worst but there were literally about a handful and they caused you no trouble whatsoever - at night the square had a bar/restaurant open up next door to the hotel so it was just filled with people having a good time (you won't notice it though - the double glazing in the hotel rooms must be made out of something very thick!) - and very handy if you fancy a night cap on the way in! the location was perfect - minutes from the main strip if you wanted it and not far from the cathedral area which had loads of lovely tapas bars. the rooms are clean and the front ones have a nice little balcony overlooking the square - the staff were pleasant and the breakfast pretty good - although i wouldnt recommend the croissants! all in all good value in a great spot

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: TaysideTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed 3 nights end of November . Taxi to the door from airport a reasonable price. Thereafter, everything in walking distance but also close to good rail/bus links. Room and bathroom more than adequate and very clean. Excellent and plentiful breakfast. Hotel is in great location and the police do keep an eye on the needy who congregate at the church in the square. However, they keep themselves to themselves and didn't appear to bother tourists. No kettle in room but little cafe/bakers next door happily made great coffees for you to take away . Staff were friendly and helpful and it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enicol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sant Agusti Hotel for a 3 day trip to celebrate a 30th birthday with a great group of friends. The hotel was in an ideal location about half way down La Ramblas, very near the market too. The reception staff and cleaners were extremely friendly and very helpful and welcoming (breakfast staff not quite so). The rooms were small but really clean and done so every day. The breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection. I would recommend this hotel and would visit again. If you are looking for a fantastic meal out I would recommend Pla - beautiful food but worth booking ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: per-occulus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June. The room was clean, breakfast was excellent and there was no need to get up early as it was available till 11am. Our only disappointment, there was no kettle in the room. There is a locked storage room for storing luggage at end of stay so we could spend time shopping/ having a final meal before being picked up by taxi in afternoon. It was an easy walk to Las Ramblas /Old Town/ sea front and the nearest metro for travelling further afield. The down and outs were no problem at all and kept to themselves, the square itself was hosed down every morning and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trenale
Reviews.Content: We paid extra to stay in an attic room which had a view over the city partially obscured by a brick wall, not sure if it was worth it for the amount of time we were there. The room was clean and adequate. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the walls are VERY thin. You can hear every word of the conversation next door. We had some people next door who returned 1am - 2am, they kept us awake for some time, not by being particularly loud, it's just that they seemed to be in the same room as us! Breakfast was ok, serve yourself and a bit of a scramble at times. The square outside seems to be frequented by homeless and drinkers, but they are no problem. There is generally a high police presence throughout Barcelona, we did not feel threatened anywhere. You just have to be sensible as a tourist as you would anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Lubbylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sant Agusti over a few days in March 2007. I had read a few scare stories on Tripadvisor about hobos hanging around in the square at this hotel. Message to these folk. Have some charity ! The poor folk are hanging around waiting for handouts from the church. Never once did we get any hassle. Location of the hotel is ideal, just off the Ramblas and has a great bar / Restaurant next door called Rita Blue. Fabulous Food ! The hotel was very welcoming, clean and super quiet. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DF1963
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a good location, just 50 metres from La Ramblas. Staff were courteous, breakfast filling (choice of hot and cold food) and rooms clean. Bedroom and bathroom overlooked the square and although the bedroom was on the small side, it was fine for the amount of time spent in it. Nice sized bathroom with good shower. Safe available to rent in room, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MancTraveller07
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal - just off La Rambla. Easy walking from Pl. Catalunya. The hotel is extremely clean and very quiet. My room was only small, but as a single travellers it was more than adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ample with a good choice. Would definatley consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: bargaintraveller
Reviews.Content: Super location just of the Ramblas, so easy to get to everywhere. The square outside is usually full of street people, but we were never bothered by then. The one big problem we had was the laminate flooring in the rooms. The people in the room above constantly walked around with heeled shoes and the noise in our room and others adjacent was terrible. The breakfast was OK but very basic. I would stay again but would look at others.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: zippy&bungle
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel for 3 day break 27th - 29th Dec, thoroughly enjoyed it, brilliant location. Stayed on the 3rd floor, room was clean & quiet. You can use safety deposit box for 1.20euro, it's in your bedroom wardrobe - gives you piece of mind for your passport, money etc. Found the Ramblas very interesting & would recommend it. Breakfast was fine, found a deal that included it in the hotel price. Tourist bus at 22 euro's for 2 days takes you to all the hotspots that you want to see. Excellent value. No problem with the homeless, they were on the other side of the square that the hotel is in, and didn't bother us at all. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: iloveeuropetoomuch
Reviews.Content: very good all round. just off ramblas which is where you want ot be. big room (we were upgraded - all you have to do is ask sometimes). very good breakfast. staff very friendly. booked direct through web site. not the cheapest but i'd stay again. free net is nice too!!

Reviews.Title: “Remember 1972”
Reviews.Author: Palmyra1
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel in superb location BUT.. the square outside is frequented by down and outs and is very noisy when windows are open. The rooms are small notably the beds which are very small. There is a lack of local information in the room. Avoid eating anywhere on Ramblas. One of the best and most economical local coffee shops is located to the LEFT of the hotel. Make sure you obtain from the local tourist information kiosk a copy of the local transport network PLUS information about the Touristic Bus. Public transport is great value. James Smith, Blakeney, Glos., UK

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: H_Taylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the San Augustin for four nights. The hotel was always clean and well presented although the square on which the hotel sits is a little run down and seedy. The main advantage of this hotel is its location. It sits one street back from La Rambla around midway between the main square at the top and the harbour at the bottom. This meant it was only a 5 minute walk to either. The only really disappointing thing about this hotel was the breakfast. We had paid in advance for all our breakfasts and I am usually a big fan of continental breakfasts but the selection was very poor. My husband and I are both big eaters and enjoy a good breakfast but after the first morning we didn't bother going down to the breakfast room again. Other than that this hotel was a god value, clean and well located place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but basic”
Reviews.Author: jinxjordan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic. Staff is friendly - well as friendly as Barcelona can get- not exactly a city known for customer service and hospitality. The location is right off Las Ramblas which in my opinion is not a necessary thing for a wonderful stay in Barcelona. What is good about it is the short walk to Placa catalunya and the shops and the Metro station that is only about 200 metres away.The Ramblas is just a loud street with no good shops, just tourist haunts and restaurants, fast food stops and full of wandering tourists and con men trying to make a quick dollar. Be aware that is unsafe at night- I wouldn't recommend it for a single woman and any nice receptionist will tell you the same, as they have often told me in Barcelona. Our rooms were extremely tiny and extremely basic, but not ugly. Bathroom was tiny- could only be used with door closed. The rooms on the top floor are rumoured to be nicer but we didn't see them. Cleanliness was okay- though we all did have some ants in our rooms. But one of our group found bedbugs in her bed and told the reception about it who promptly apologized and moved all her things into a new room while we were out. When she wanted to retrieve something left in her old room she found that they had already moved a new guest into it- the same day! That poor fella. Breakfast is basic with toast, very dry rolls and pastries, scrambled eggs, sausages, yoghurt. Service at breakfast was very friendly. Internet access in the lobby was free. We moved to another hotel for the second part of our stay to meet friends, the Apsis Milleni- this was not as close to Las Ramblas as the Sant Agusti, but at the same price had a real 4 star quality to it and was completely modern and comfortable- read our review. All in all the Sant Agusti was a basic and clean place to stay with all the necessary amenities and a friendly staff trying to please, - located right in the middle of the tourist action without being affected by too much noise. Unless you need to be right on the Ramblas or are staying in a superior top floor room you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: sandra_flitwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last September as we wanted a location close to the Ramblas. On other occasions I've stayed in the Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. The Sant Augusti is in a great handy location, just round the corner from the Ramblas on a small square. You do need to be careful in this area, especially at night time, as there are some less than desirable types who hang around. We had no real problems, thankfully. We were given an excellent room on the top floor which had amazing views of Barcelona. The ceiling had lovely oak beams, be careful if you are on the top floor , as you might bump your head on them!! Perhaps because we were on the top floor, we were not disturbed at all by other guests. Breakfasts were very good, however, I would avoid drinking the tap water provided at breakfast, as I got a very upset tummy after drinking it! Despite that I would recommend this hotel as a very comfortable and convenient location for a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: pvs
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a brilliant 4 nights break in this fascinating city. Hotel centrally placed just off La Ramblas , we were able to reach most sights on foot.Hotel very clean & comfortable, lovely buffet breakfast. We also dined there twice , found the food excellent value- E9.50 for tourist menu, E12.50 for an authentic Catalan meal (including large jug Sangria!) Shame about the "down&outs" inhabiting the Placa San Agusti in front of the hotel though we did notice that the placa was sometimes hosed down (by the local council?)during the early hours which temporarily cleared it! A WARNING - beware of lost "Greek tourist", he stopped us on a quiet street, asked if we were English and could we give him directions.Then appeared a smartly dressed man who produced a badge, claiming to be the drugs police. He told us we were in a very dangerous drug-dealing/using area and implied we were committing an offence.This was very scary! He then insisted on examining our wallets and wanted to see a credit card as identification. The Greek produced a card, the "policeman" then said he also needed the PIN for ID- to be keyed into his mobile phone! This the Greek pretended to do (by now we realised this was a scam)and the policeman expected my husband to do the same. My husband held tightly on to his wallet and insisted he had no credit card, I think the men then realised they had been rumbled and disappeared! This experience was most unsettling and we are now very wary when approached by strangers.Apart from this we thoroughly enjoyed our holiday and would certainly return to the Hotel San Agusti.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise spot, friendly staff and near the Las Ramblas action”
Reviews.Author: CarolineT08
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for one night to recover from jet lag before we boarded our cruise ship. The courtyard-square entrance to the hotel is charming, the rooms are comfortable (although we requested a move, due to a/c problems, which was promptly arranged by friendly staff) The bathroom was clean and modernized, and the breakfast was quite good. Highlights: Ambiance and historical feel, proximity to Las Ramblas and friendly, albeit quiky, staff. The gentleman at the front desk suggested a small restauraunt around the corner and down the alley for Paella... off the beaten tourist track, and obviously a place for locals. Our meal was reasonably priced, and the Paella was superb. I can still see the sizzling pan with fresh seafood and saffron rice in my mind's-eye... What a start to the wonderful family trip! Barcelona is a wonderful and friendly city, and this hotel is a great frist stop!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about the Hotel. It's just off Las Ramblas so you get very little street noise. It's also very close to a metro stop. Yes, the walls are paper thin but the only noise is at a reasonable hour in the morning. I didn't come to Barelona to sleep!! The clientel are older. Not a party crowd which would explain the morning noise and not the evening noise. Very clean and comfortable. Good continental breakfast which was included.
